dt.un: used to refer to what is true or real I don't know what actually [=really] happened. After all these months, it's hard to believe that we're actually [=really, truly] finished.

used to stress that a statement is true especially when it differs in some way from what might have been thought or expected We'd actually planned to leave early, but we were delayed. I wasn't worried about being late. Actually, I didn't want to go at all. I didn't think I'd like the movie, but it was actually pretty good. I was shocked to learn he could actually fly a plane. I could hardly believe it when she actually apologized to me. “I like your new glasses.” “Thanks, but actually I've had them for almost a year.”
